intro: Torenia laotica, commonly known as the Laos morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. Torenia laotica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in moist, well-drained soil.
